[Packages](/docs/apis/) &gt; [@fluid-tools/api-markdown-documenter](/docs/apis/api-markdown-documenter)

Contains a programatic API for generating [Markdown](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Markdown) documentation from an API report generated by [API-Extractor](https://api-extractor.com/)<!-- -->.

## Remarks {#_fluid-tools_api-markdown-documenter-remarks}

Akin to [API-Documenter](https://github.com/microsoft/rushstack/tree/main/apps/api-documenter) and is heavily based upon it, but is designed to be more extensible and to be be used programatically.

### DocumentationNodeType {#documentationnodetype-enum}

Kinds of [DocumentationNode](/docs/apis/api-markdown-documenter\documentationnode-interface) known inherently by the system.

#### Signature {#documentationnodetype-signature}


Any given [DocumentationNode](/docs/apis/api-markdown-documenter\documentationnode-interface) implementation will specify a unique value as its [DocumentationNode.type](/docs/apis/api-markdown-documenter\documentationnode-interface#type-propertysignature)<!-- -->.

## Type Details

### ApiFunctionLike {#apifunctionlike-typealias}

`ApiItem` union type representing function-like API kinds.

#### Signature {#apifunctionlike-signature}

```typescript
export declare type ApiFunctionLike = ApiConstructSignature | ApiConstructor | ApiFunction | ApiMethod | ApiMethodSignature;
```

### ApiMemberKind {#apimemberkind-typealias}

Represents "member" API item kinds. These are the kinds of items the system supports generally for rendering, file-system, etc. policies.

#### Signature {#apimemberkind-signature}

```typescript
export declare type ApiMemberKind = Omit<ApiItemKind, ApiItemKind.EntryPoint | ApiItemKind.Model | ApiItemKind.None | ApiItemKind.Package>;
```

#### Remarks {#apimemberkind-remarks}

This type explicitly excludes the following API item kinds represented in API-Extractor models:

- `None`

- `EntryPoint`

- `Model`

- `Package`

### ApiModuleLike {#apimodulelike-typealias}

`ApiItem` union type representing module-like API kinds.

#### Signature {#apimodulelike-signature}

```typescript
export declare type ApiModuleLike = ApiPackage | ApiNamespace;
```

### ApiSignatureLike {#apisignaturelike-typealias}

`ApiItem` union type representing call-signature-like API kinds.

#### Signature {#apisignaturelike-signature}

```typescript
export declare type ApiSignatureLike = ApiCallSignature | ApiIndexSignature;
```

### CreateChildContentSections {#createchildcontentsections-typealias}

Signature for a function which generates information about an API item with inner content injected into the same section.

#### Signature {#createchildcontentsections-signature}

```typescript
export declare type CreateChildContentSections = (apiItem: ApiItem, childSections: SectionNode[] | undefined, config: Required<MarkdownDocumenterConfiguration>) => SectionNode[];
```

### DocumentBoundaries {#documentboundaries-typealias}

List of item kinds for which separate documents should be generated. Items specified will be rendered to their own documents. Items not specified will be rendered into their parent's contents.

#### Signature {#documentboundaries-signature}

```typescript
export declare type DocumentBoundaries = ApiMemberKind[];
```

#### Remarks {#documentboundaries-remarks}

Note that `Model` and `Package` items will \*always\* have separate documents generated for them, even if not specified.

Also note that `EntryPoint` items will always be ignored by the system, even if specified here.

#### Example {#documentboundaries-example}

A configuration like the following:

```typescript
...
documentBoundaries: [
 ApiItemKind.Namespace,
],
...
```
will result in separate documents being generated for `Namespace` items, but will not for other item kinds (`Classes`<!-- -->, `Interfaces`<!-- -->, etc.).

### FileNamePolicy {#filenamepolicy-typealias}

Policy for generating file names.

#### Signature {#filenamepolicy-signature}

```typescript
export declare type FileNamePolicy = (apiItem: ApiItem) => string;
```

#### Remarks {#filenamepolicy-remarks}

Note that this is not the complete file name, but the "leaf" component of the final file name. Additional prefixes and suffixes will be appended to ensure file name collisions do not occur.

This also does not contain the file extension.

#### Example {#filenamepolicy-example}

We are given a class API item "Bar" in package "Foo". This policy returns "foo". The final file name might be something like "foo-bar-class".

### FrontMatterPolicy {#frontmatterpolicy-typealias}

Policy for generating document-level front-matter contents, which will be included at the top of a generated document.

#### Signature {#frontmatterpolicy-signature}

```typescript
export declare type FrontMatterPolicy = (documentItem: ApiItem) => string | undefined;
```

#### Remarks {#frontmatterpolicy-remarks}

Note: this is arbitrary text, and will not be escaped.

### HeadingTitlePolicy {#headingtitlepolicy-typealias}

Policy for generating heading titles for API items.

#### Signature {#headingtitlepolicy-signature}

```typescript
export declare type HeadingTitlePolicy = (apiItem: ApiItem) => string;
```

### HierarchyBoundaries {#hierarchyboundaries-typealias}

List of item kinds for which sub-directories will be generated, and under which child item documents will be created. If not specified for an item kind, any children of items of that kind will be generated adjacent to the parent.

#### Signature {#hierarchyboundaries-signature}

```typescript
export declare type HierarchyBoundaries = ApiMemberKind[];
```

#### Remarks {#hierarchyboundaries-remarks}

Note that `Package` items will \*always\* have separate documents generated for them, even if not specified.

#### Example {#hierarchyboundaries-example}

A configuration like the following:

```typescript
...
hierarchyBoundaries: [
 ApiItemKind.Namespace,
],
...
```
will result in documents rendered for children of the `Namespace` to be generated in a subdirectory named after the `Namespace` item.

So for some namespace `Foo` with children `Bar` and `Baz` (assuming `Bar` and `Baz` are item kinds matching the configured [PolicyOptions.documentBoundaries](/docs/apis/api-markdown-documenter\policyoptions-interface#documentboundaries-propertysignature)<!-- -->), the resulting file structure would look like the following:

```
foo.md
foo
 | bar.md
 | baz.md
```

### LinkTextPolicy {#linktextpolicy-typealias}

#### Signature {#linktextpolicy-signature}

```typescript
export declare type LinkTextPolicy = (apiItem: ApiItem) => string;
```

### getFilePathForApiItem {#getfilepathforapiitem-function}

#### Signature {#getfilepathforapiitem-signature}

```typescript
export declare function getFilePathForApiItem(apiItem: ApiItem, config: Required<MarkdownDocumenterConfiguration>): string;
```

#### Remarks {#getfilepathforapiitem-remarks}

In the case of an item that does not get rendered to its own document, this will point to the document of the ancestor item under which the provided item will be rendered.

The generated path is relative to [MarkdownDocumenterConfiguration.uriRoot](/docs/apis/api-markdown-documenter\markdowndocumenterconfiguration-interface#uriroot-propertysignature)<!-- -->.

### loadModel {#loadmodel-function}

Reads API reports generated by [API-Extractor](https://api-extractor.com/) (.api.json files) under the provided directory path, and generates an `ApiModel` from them.

#### Signature {#loadmodel-signature}

```typescript
export declare function loadModel(reportsDirectoryPath: string, logger?: Logger): Promise<ApiModel>;
```

#### Remarks {#loadmodel-remarks}

The resulting `ApiModel` can be passed to [transformApiModel()](/docs/apis/api-markdown-documenter#transformapimodel-function) or [renderApiModelAsMarkdown()](/docs/apis/api-markdown-documenter#renderapimodelasmarkdown-function) to generate API documentation for the model and its packages.

#### Parameters {#loadmodel-parameters}

<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
  <thead>
    <tr>
      <th scope="col">
        Parameter
      </th>
      <th scope="col">
        Modifiers
      </th>
      <th scope="col">
        Type
      </th>
      <th scope="col">
        Description
      </th>
    </tr>
  </thead>
  <tbody>
    <tr>
      <td>
        reportsDirectoryPath
      </td>
      <td>
      </td>
      <td>
        string
      </td>
      <td>
        Path to the directory containing the API reports.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>
        logger
      </td>
      <td>
        optional
      </td>
      <td>
        <a href='/docs/apis/api-markdown-documenter\logger-interface'>Logger</a>
      </td>
      <td>
        Optional logger for reporting system events while loading the model.
      </td>
    </tr>
  </tbody>
</table>

#### Returns {#loadmodel-returns}

<b>Return type:</b> Promise&lt;ApiModel&gt;

```typescript
export declare function markdownDocumenterConfigurationWithDefaults(partialConfig: MarkdownDocumenterConfiguration): Required<MarkdownDocumenterConfiguration>;
```

### renderApiModelAsMarkdown {#renderapimodelasmarkdown-function}

Renders the provided model and its contents, and writes each document to a file on disk.

#### Signature {#renderapimodelasmarkdown-signature}

```typescript
export declare function renderApiModelAsMarkdown(partialConfig: MarkdownDocumenterConfiguration, outputDirectoryPath: string, customRenderers?: MarkdownRenderers): Promise<void>;
```

#### Remarks {#renderapimodelasmarkdown-remarks}

Which API members get their own documents and which get written to the contents of their parent is determined by [PolicyOptions.documentBoundaries](/docs/apis/api-markdown-documenter\policyoptions-interface#documentboundaries-propertysignature)<!-- -->.

The file paths under which the files will be saved is determined by the provided output path and the following configuration properties:

- [PolicyOptions.documentBoundaries](/docs/apis/api-markdown-documenter\policyoptions-interface#documentboundaries-propertysignature) - [PolicyOptions.hierarchyBoundaries](/docs/apis/api-markdown-documenter\policyoptions-interface#hierarchyboundaries-propertysignature)

#### Parameters {#renderapimodelasmarkdown-parameters}

<table class="table table-striped table-hover">
  <thead>
    <tr>
      <th scope="col">
        Parameter
      </th>
      <th scope="col">
        Modifiers
      </th>
      <th scope="col">
        Type
      </th>
      <th scope="col">
        Description
      </th>
    </tr>
  </thead>
  <tbody>
    <tr>
      <td>
        partialConfig
      </td>
      <td>
      </td>
      <td>
        <a href='/docs/apis/api-markdown-documenter\markdowndocumenterconfiguration-interface'>MarkdownDocumenterConfiguration</a>
      </td>
      <td>
        A partial <a href='/docs/apis/api-markdown-documenter\markdowndocumenterconfiguration-interface'>MarkdownDocumenterConfiguration</a>. Missing values will be filled in with defaults defined by <a href='/docs/apis/api-markdown-documenter#markdowndocumenterconfigurationwithdefaults-function'>markdownDocumenterConfigurationWithDefaults()</a>.
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>
        outputDirectoryPath
      </td>
      <td>
      </td>
      <td>
        string
      </td>
      <td>
      </td>
    </tr>
    <tr>
      <td>
        customRenderers
      </td>
      <td>
        optional
      </td>
      <td>
        <a href='/docs/apis/api-markdown-documenter\markdownrenderers-interface'>MarkdownRenderers</a>
      </td>
      <td>
        Custom rendering policies. Specified per <a href='/docs/apis/api-markdown-documenter\documentationnode-interface#type-propertysignature'>DocumentationNode.type</a>.
      </td>
    </tr>
  </tbody>
</table>

#### Returns {#renderapimodelasmarkdown-returns}

<b>Return type:</b> Promise&lt;void&gt;

### transformApiModel {#transformapimodel-function}

Which API members get their own documents and which get written to the contents of their parent is determined by [PolicyOptions.documentBoundaries](/docs/apis/api-markdown-documenter\policyoptions-interface#documentboundaries-propertysignature)<!-- -->.
